info.title: Glasswall File Rebuild Product API
info.description: The Rebuild API provides developers the pathway to obtaining safe and secure files.

get.description:
Description:

This endpoint is to check the health of the system.

200.description: OK - The request was processed successfully and service is up and running.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - This happens when an HTTP method is not allowed by a server for a requested URL.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - This happens when the payload format is in an unsupported format. The format problem might be due to the request's indicated Content-Type.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

500.description: Internal Server Error - This is usually when something wrong on the server.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

post.summary: Rebuilds a file using its binary data
post.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. File is sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. The Rebuilt file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

file.description: The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

200.description: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the rebuilt file.

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files binary data to download.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

400.description: Bad Request - This is usually when the input is malformed or missing parameters

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - This happens when an HTTP method is not allowed by a server for a requested URL.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - This happens when the payload format is in an unsupported format. The format problem might be due to the request's indicated Content-Type.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

500.description: Internal Server Error - This is usually when something wrong on the server.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

post.summary: Rebuilds a file using the Base64 encoded representation
post.description: This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. The request body contains the Base64 representation of the file with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'. A Base64 Representation of the rebuilt file is then returned in the response with a 'Content-Type' of 'text/plain'.

Base64.description: This is the Base64 encoded representation of the file to rebuild.

200.description: OK - The requested Base64 was successfully decoded and processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

schema.description: The body is a rebuilt file, Base64 encoded.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

400.description: Bad Request - This is usually when the JSON input is malformed or missing parameters

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - This happens when the payload format is in an unsupported format. The format problem might be due to the request's indicated Content-Type.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

500.description: Internal Server Error - This is usually when something wrong on the server.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

post.summary: Analyse a file using the Base64 encoded representation
post.description: This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. The request body contains the Base64 representation of the file with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'. The Report file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

Base64.description: This is the Base64 encoded representation of the file to rebuild.

200.description: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the report xml file.

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the report xml file binary data to download.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

get.summary: Returns a xml report file using its FileId.
get.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts FileId to fetch the xml report.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the xml report file's binary content to the client.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: A value of 'FileId', based on will return the xml report file's binary content to the client.

200.description: OK - The request was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine and the xml report file's binary content is returned to the client.

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the xml report file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the xml report files binary data to download

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

post.summary: Returns a zip file with all available data using the Base64 encoded representation
post.description: This endpoint accepts requests to fetch all the available data that is processed by Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. The request body contains the Base64 representation of the file with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'. The zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

Base64.description: This is the Base64 encoded representation of the file to rebuild.

200.description: OK - The request was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine and the zip file's binary content is returned to the client.

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the zip file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the xml report files binary data to download

post.summary: Returns a zip file with all available data using its binary data.
post.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to return all available data corresponding to a input file processed by Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. File is sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. The zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the zip file's binary content to the client.

file.description: The binary contents of the selected file will be uploaded to the server.

200.description: OK - The request was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine and the zip file's binary content is returned to the client.

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the zip file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the xml report files binary data to download

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

post.summary: Detect a file type and other information using the Base64 encoded representation
post.description: This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. The request body contains the Base64 representation of the file with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'. File information then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/json'.

Base64.description: This is the Base64 encoded representation of the file to rebuild.

200.description: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

post.summary: Rebuilds a zip file using its binary data
post.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a zip file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. The file is sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. Rebuilt zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

file.description: The binary contents of the selected zip file will be uploaded to the server.

200.description: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the rebuilt file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files binary data to download

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

207.description: Multi-Status - The requested file was processed with error report by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine.

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the rebuilt files and ErrorHtml file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files and ErrorHtml binary data to download

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

400.description: Bad Request - This is usually when the input is malformed or all the files in zip are unprocessable by SDK Engine or missing parameters

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

post.summary: Rebuilds a protected zip file using its binary data and password.
post.description:
Description:

This endpoint accepts requests to rebuild a protected zip file with Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine. Both protected file and password are sent in the request body with a 'Content-Type' of 'multipart/form-data'. Rebuilt zip file is then returned in the response body with a 'Content-Type' of 'application/octet-stream'.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: A value of 'application/octet-stream' will return the rebuilt file's binary content to the client.

file.description: The binary contents of the selected protected zip file will be uploaded to the server.

password.description: Password for the protected zip file.

200.description: OK - The requested file was processed by the Glasswall d-FIRST™ Engine

schema.description: The body is a binary stream, containing the rebuilt file

Content-Disposition.description: This contains the details of the rebuilt files binary data to download

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

400.description: Bad Request - This is usually when the input is malformed or missing parameters

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.

Via.description: Name of the machine which processed the request.

X-SDK-Engine-Version.description: Version of the GW SDK Engine.

X-SDK-Api-Version.description: Version of the Cloud SDK Api.
